article_title: View Is Uneasy from One Violent New York City Neighborhood
article_text:
In East New York on a Sunday afternoon, a group of young men lingered on a corner along New Lots Avenue, talking among themselves as a police cruiser rolled slowly past.

From across the street, Daquan Reed sighed and held tight to the two tiny hands by his side.

“I worry about them every single day,” said Mr. Reed, looking at his daughter...

twitter.description: Brooklyn’s East New York neighborhood is on the front line of a rise in homicides and shootings in New York City, and many resident there say they feel less safe than they did a year ago.
twitter.creator: @MaraGay

image.alt: View is uneasy from one violent New York City neighborhood
